description: Breastfeeding the baby frequently helps mom produce more milk.
title: Breastfeeding the baby frequently helps mom produce more milk
content:
- A mother's breasts make as much milk as the baby wants. If the baby
   suckles more, more milk is produced.

 - The mother will produce more milk if she does not give the child
   other food or liquids and if she breastfeeds often.

 - Holding the baby in a good position makes it easier for the baby to
   take the breast well into the mouth and suckle. A baby should feed as
   often and for as long as she or he wants.

 - Pacifiers, dummies or bottles should be avoided as a baby may suckle
   less at the breast, which reduces milk production.

 - All mothers need encouragement and support, especially from the
   child's father and their families, to breastfeed their baby
   exclusively for 6 months.

 - A mother who has undergone a Caesarean birth may require extra help
   to begin breastfeeding her baby.
